narrative.title: Eighth Army 8Th Army - 1942Q1
narrative.situation: British Field Army deployed in North Africa during 1942Q1.
narrative.objectives: Army-level command defending Gazala Line and preparing for offensive operations. Two corps (XIII and XXX) with armored and infantry divisions. Counter Axis forces in Cyrenaica.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: coastal desert, Gazala Line prepared positions

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: M3 Grant tanks with 75mm guns arriving Q1 1942 (technological advantage)
Superior logistics (300km from Egyptian bases vs Axis 1,800km from Tripoli)
Naval and air superiority enabling reinforcement and supply
6-pounder AT guns (57mm) superior to Italian 47mm guns

environment.terrain_type: coastal desert, Gazala Line prepared positions
